The makers also came up with a few anachronistic characters and even a few less expected twists that added to the overall entertainment.  

I had never heard of the main actors before but really loved their performance. I do not want to go into developments here because of spoiling surprises, save for one: an Italian billionaire son turns up who is actually not at all serious about wine making or running a business, but just into having fun with all his money. The comic relief ? Or is that intended to be the very stiff and clumsy German... well, just go see it if you have not already and enjoy the anachronistic add-ons, the very charming very nice French Father with the equally charming accent (thank heaven for French speaking English and God forbid the English speaking French with a fat English accent !) and the chemistry between the very goodlooking (of course) main actors.
Perfect cheesy holiday romance! The vibes were impeccable!

I just finished watching Champagne Problems on Netflix and I absolutely loved it. First of all, the setting was in Paris which felt so refreshing since most Christmas movies are always in New York or Chicago. It was beautiful to see a different city for once and the Paris backdrop made the whole film feel extra magical. My  favourite was Roberto played by Sean Amsing. I have always been an enormous fan of the actor John Lovitz and Roberto’s hilarious personality gave me total John-Lovitz! He absolutely stole every scene he appeared in. One of my favourite quotes from the movie is when Roberto says, "Doesn’t matter if your glass of champagne is half full or half empty, as long as the glass is refillable." That line alone deserves an award. Overall this movie has the perfect mix of witty silliness, a bit of cheese (or should I say fromage), a sweet storyline and gorgeous scenery. Five stars from me. A must-watch for the holidays. Oh, and let’s also give five stars to the dog bubbles 🍾🥂
